title: Sr. Materials & Process Engineer (Thermoplastic Composites)

pay_input_ranges.title: The pay range for this position is:
pay_input_ranges.blurb: Base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge and location. This position is also eligible for a bonus as part of total compensation.

content:
Supernal is at the forefront of creating emerging mobility solutions that will foster the development of human-centered cities. We are designing a completely new electric vertical take-off and landing (eVTOL) aircraft tailored to the mobility needs of future cities. This allows passengers a seamless intermodal journey that safely transports them to their final destination. We fuse research in autonomy, robotics, aviation and services to define a new category of mobility for the world’s communities. We believe in creative thinking and collaboration to help build a better mobility experience for everyone, improving people’s ability to move – whether for work or play.
What we do: 
The Sr. Materials & Process Engineer applies their technical knowledge and expertise in thermoplastic composites to support components across our vehicle. This role works toward building and implementing conventional and novel materials and process solutions while working with our partners to ensure delivered hardware that meets requirements that leads to the certification and production of new AAM vehicles. This position collaborates with all Engineering verticals & Supply Chain teams during the design process.
This position will be required to work on-site 5 days a week.
What you can do:

Coordinate crafting design requirements & standard methodologies for all hardware on the vehicle
Own the evaluation & selection of thermoplastic composite materials and auxiliary material solutions to satisfy design requirements
Lead development of thermoplastic processes which include part fabrication, joining & assemblies
Write internal material specifications and process specifications that support manufacturing & ensure quality
Lead & coordinate testing for method development, materials characterization, allowables generation, and design validation
Serve as the M&P representative (Signatory Authority) in design reviews, in production drawing release cycle for hardware components/assemblies, and on Material Review Board (MRB) issues
Coordinate and oversee supplier selection, development, qualifications, and ongoing evaluations
Build procedures for reviewing supplier delivered (source controlled) hardware for compliance with requirements
Assist in building top-level M&P control plans and documentation
Support the manufacture of hardware in-house, and at suppliers
Dedicated participation in industry working groups, standards bodies, and relevant technical conferences and symposia to maintain awareness of technology developments & regulatory trends across academia and industry
Mentor junior engineers
May require up to 25% of domestic and international travel
Other duties as assigned

What you can contribute:

Bachelor's degree in STEM or related field required
Minimum of five (5) years of related experience (an equivalent combination of education and experience may be considered)
Experience with process mapping, SPC, PFMEA, DFMEA and similar tools/techniques
Experience with qualification and implementation of automated/robotic composite
Technical superiority in these areas: Thermoplastic composites, adhesives, physical & mechanical material characterization, composite material allowables generation & certification
Deep understanding of thermoplastic composites & adhesive materials, and processing methods used for various applications found in aircraft structures
Demonstrated ability to lead material allowable certification programs
Knowledge of fabrication methods in a high-rate manufacturing environment
Familiarity with 3D CAD software (CATIA, SolidWorks, NX, or similar)
Proficiency at drafting test plans, coordinating & implementing test campaigns, and generating test reports
Operational knowledge of materials characterization lab equipment
Familiarity with statistical software, including Minitab, JMP, or similar
Knowledge of CMH-17, SAE, ASTM, and other standard bodies
Proficiency MS Office Suite tools such as Word, Excel, Project & Visio
Understanding of a first principles' approach to problem solving
Solid understanding of Six Sigma, Lean, & DOE principals
Proactive and efficient delivery of communication and follow-up
Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail
Must have the ability to independently prioritize and accomplish work in a timely manner

You may also be able to contribute:

Six Sigma Green Belt or higher preferred

Any offer of employment is conditioned upon the successful completion of a background check. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status or any other category or class protected under applicable federal, state or local law. Individuals with disabilities may request a reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation at: ta-support@supernal.aero
This position may include access to certain technology and/or software source code subject to U.S. export controls laws and regulations. If an export authorization from an applicable US regulatory agency is required in connection with your employment, your employment is contingent upon Supernal’s receipt of such regulatory authorization(s) and your continued compliance with all conditions and limitations pursuant to such authorization(s).
 Base pay offered may vary depending on skills, experience, job-related knowledge and location. This position is also eligible for a bonus as part of total compensation.The pay range for this position is:$166,400—$232,960 USDClick HERE or visit: https://jobs.supernal.aero/benefits to view our benefits!
